items.name: RESOURCEMANAGER_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: ResourceManager Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, key-value pairs (one on each line) to be inserted into a role's environment. Applies to configurations of this role except client configuration.

items.name: enable_alerts
items.displayName: Enable Health Alerts for this Role
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when the health of this role reaches the threshold specified by the EventServer setting eventserver_health_events_alert_threshold

items.name: enable_config_alerts
items.description: When set, Cloudera Manager will send alerts when this entity's configuration changes.

items.name: hadoop_metrics2_safety_valve
items.displayName: Hadoop Metrics2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for Hadoop Metrics2. Properties will be inserted into hadoop-metrics2.properties.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory.

items.name: heap_dump_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's heap dump directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Heap Dump Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: ResourceManager Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: For advanced use only, a string to be inserted into log4j.properties for this role only.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_absolute_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory.

items.name: log_directory_free_space_percentage_thresholds
items.displayName: Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Percentage Thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for monitoring of free space on the filesystem that contains this role's log directory. Specified as a percentage of the capacity on that filesystem. This setting is not used if a Log Directory Free Space Monitoring Absolute Thresholds setting is configured.

items.name: log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description:
This file contains the rules that govern how log messages are turned into events by the custom log4j appender that this role loads. It is in JSON format, and is composed of a list of rules. Every log message is evaluated against each of these rules in turn to decide whether or not to send an event for that message. If a log message matches multiple rules, the first matching rule is used.

Each rule has some or all of the following fields:

  • alert - whether or not events generated from this rule should be promoted to alerts. A value of "true" will cause alerts to be generated. If not specified, the default is "false".
  • rate (mandatory) - the maximum number of log messages matching this rule that can be sent as events every minute. If more than rate matching log messages are received in a single minute, the extra messages are ignored. If rate is less than 0, the number of messages per minute is unlimited.
  • periodminutes - the number of minutes during which the publisher will only publish rate events or fewer. If not specified, the default is one minute
  • threshold - apply this rule only to messages with this log4j severity level or above. An example is "WARN" for warning level messages or higher.
  • content - match only those messages for which contents match this regular expression.
  • exceptiontype - match only those messages that are part of an exception message. The exception type must match this regular expression.

Example:

  • {"alert": false, "rate": 10, "exceptiontype": "java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException"}
    This rule sends events to Cloudera Manager for every StringIndexOutOfBoundsException, up to a maximum of 10 every minute.
  • {"alert": false, "rate": 1, "periodminutes": 1, "exceptiontype": ".*"}, {"alert": true, "rate": 1, "periodminutes": 1, "threshold":"ERROR"}
    In this example, an event generated may not be promoted to alert if an exception is in the ERROR log message, because the first rule with alert = false will match.

items.name: log_threshold
items.description: The minimum log level for ResourceManager logs

items.name: max_log_backup_index
items.description: The maximum number of rolled log files to keep for ResourceManager logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: max_log_size
items.description: The maximum size, in megabytes, per log file for ResourceManager logs.  Typically used by log4j or logback.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_dir
items.description: Path to directory where heap dumps are generated when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError error is thrown. This directory is automatically created if it does not exist. If this directory already exists, role user must have write access to this directory. If this directory is shared among multiple roles, it should have 1777 permissions. The heap dump files are created with 600 permissions and are owned by the role user. The amount of free space in this directory should be greater than the maximum Java Process heap size configured for this role.

items.name: oom_heap_dump_enabled
items.displayName: Dump Heap When Out of Memory
items.description: When set, generates heap dump file when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: oom_sigkill_enabled
items.description: When set, a SIGKILL signal is sent to the role process when java.lang.OutOfMemoryError is thrown.

items.name: process_auto_restart
items.description: When set, this role's process is automatically (and transparently) restarted in the event of an unexpected failure.

items.name: process_should_monitor
items.description: Cloudera Manager agent monitors each service and each of its role by publishing metrics to the Cloudera Manager Service Monitor. Setting it to false will stop Cloudera Manager agent from publishing any metric for corresponding service/roles. This is usually helpful for services that generate large amount of metrics which Service Monitor is not able to process.

items.name: process_swap_memory_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the swap memory usage of the process.

items.name: resource_manager_java_heapsize
items.displayName: Java Heap Size of ResourceManager in Bytes
items.description: Maximum size in bytes for the Java Process heap memory.  Passed to Java -Xmx.

items.name: resource_manager_java_opts
items.description: These arguments will be passed as part of the Java command line. Commonly, garbage collection flags, PermGen, or extra debugging flags would be passed here.

items.name: resource_manager_log_dir
items.description: Directory where ResourceManager will place its log files.

items.name: resourcemanager_capacity_scheduler_configuration
items.displayName: Capacity Scheduler Configuration Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Enter an XML string that represents the Capacity Scheduler configuration.

items.name: resourcemanager_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only. A string to be inserted into yarn-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_assign_multiple
items.description: Enables multiple Fair Scheduler container assignments in one heartbeat, which improves cluster throughput when there are many small tasks to run.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_configuration
items.displayName: Fair Scheduler XML Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: An XML string that will be inserted verbatim into the Fair Scheduler allocations file. For CDH5, overrides the configuration set using the Pools configuration UI. For CDH4, this is the only way to configure the Fair Scheduler for YARN.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_dynamic_max_assign
items.description: During node heartbeat, the ResourceManager will allocate up to half the available resources on a node. Only valid if yarn.scheduler.fair.assignmultiple is set to true.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_locality_threshold_node
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular nodes, the number of scheduling opportunities since the last container assignment to wait before accepting a placement on another node. Expressed as a float between 0 and 1, which, as a fraction of the cluster size, is the number of scheduling opportunities to pass up. If not set, this means don't pass up any scheduling opportunities. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be disabled. If continuous scheduling is enabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality-delay-node-ms should be used instead.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_locality_threshold_rack
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular racks, the number of scheduling opportunities since the last container assignment to wait before accepting a placement on another rack. Expressed as a float between 0 and 1, which, as a fraction of the cluster size, is the number of scheduling opportunities to pass up. If not set, this means don't pass up any scheduling opportunities. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be disabled. If continuous scheduling is enabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality-delay-rack-ms should be used instead.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_max_assign
items.description: Limit the number of containers allocated by the ResourceManager with each node heartbeat. -1 is equivalent to unlimited. Only valid if yarn.scheduler.fair.assignmultiple is true and yarn.scheduler.fair.dynamic.max.assign is false.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_preemption
items.description: When enabled, if a pool's minimum share is not met for some period of time, the Fair Scheduler preempts applications in other pools. Preemption guarantees that production applications are not starved while also allowing the cluster to be used for experimental and research applications. To minimize wasted computation, the Fair Scheduler preempts the most recently launched applications.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_size_based_weight
items.description: When enabled, the Fair Scheduler will assign shares to individual apps based on their size, rather than providing an equal share to all apps regardless of size.

items.name: resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_user_as_default_queue
items.displayName: Fair Scheduler User As Default Queue
items.description: When set to true, the Fair Scheduler uses the username as the default pool name, in the event that a pool name is not specified. When set to false, all applications are run in a shared pool, called default.

items.name: resourcemanager_fd_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds of the number of file descriptors used. Specified as a percentage of file descriptor limit.

items.name: resourcemanager_gc_duration_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for the weighted average time spent in Java garbage collection. Specified as a percentage of elapsed wall clock time.

items.name: resourcemanager_gc_duration_window
items.description: The period to review when computing the moving average of garbage collection time.

items.name: resourcemanager_host_health_enabled
items.description: When computing the overall ResourceManager health, consider the host's health.

items.name: resourcemanager_mapred_safety_valve
items.displayName: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml
items.description: For advanced use only. A string to be inserted into mapred-site.xml for this role only.

items.name: resourcemanager_scm_health_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the ResourceManager's process state is consistent with the role configuration

items.name: resourcemanager_startup_tolerance_minutes
items.description: The amount of time allowed after this role is started that failures of health tests that rely on communication with this role will be tolerated.

items.name: resourcemanager_web_metric_collection_enabled
items.description: Enables the health test that the Cloudera Manager Agent can successfully contact and gather metrics from the web server.

items.name: resourcemanager_web_metric_collection_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds on the duration of the metrics request to the web server.

items.name: resourcemanager_webserver_https_port
items.description: The HTTPS port of the ResourceManager web application.

items.name: resourcemanager_webserver_port
items.description: The HTTP port of the ResourceManager web application.

items.name: rlimit_fds
items.description: If configured, overrides the process soft and hard rlimits (also called ulimits) for file descriptors to the configured value.

items.name: rm_cpu_shares
items.description: Number of CPU shares to assign to this role. The greater the number of shares, the larger the share of the host's CPUs that will be given to this role when the host experiences CPU contention. Must be between 2 and 262144. Defaults to 1024 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: rm_hosts_allow_safety_valve
items.displayName: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for nodes_allow.txt
items.description: For advanced use only. A string to be inserted into nodes_allow.txt for this role only.

items.name: rm_hosts_exclude_safety_valve
items.displayName: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for nodes_exclude.txt
items.description: For advanced use only. A string to be inserted into nodes_exclude.txt for this role only.

items.name: rm_io_weight
items.description: Weight for the read I/O requests issued by this role. The greater the weight, the higher the priority of the requests when the host experiences I/O contention. Must be between 100 and 1000. Defaults to 1000 for processes not managed by Cloudera Manager.

items.name: rm_memory_hard_limit
items.description: Hard memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: rm_memory_soft_limit
items.description: Soft memory limit to assign to this role, enforced by the Linux kernel. When the limit is reached, the kernel will reclaim pages charged to the process if and only if the host is facing memory pressure. If reclaiming fails, the kernel may kill the process. Both anonymous as well as page cache pages contribute to the limit. Use a value of -1 B to specify no limit. By default processes not managed by Cloudera Manager will have no limit.

items.name: role_config_suppression_cdh_version_validator
items.displayName: Suppress Configuration Validator: CDH Version Validator
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the CDH Version Validator configuration validator.

items.name: role_config_suppression_hadoop_metrics2_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Hadoop Metrics2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Hadoop Metrics2 Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_log4j_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Logging Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_log_event_whitelist
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Rules to Extract Events from Log Files
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Rules to Extract Events from Log Files parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_oom_heap_dump_dir
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Heap Dump Directory
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Heap Dump Directory parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resource_manager_java_opts
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Java Configuration Options for ResourceManager
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Java Configuration Options for ResourceManager parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resource_manager_log_dir
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Log Directory
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Log Directory parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resourcemanager_capacity_scheduler_configuration
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Capacity Scheduler Configuration Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Capacity Scheduler Configuration Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resourcemanager_config_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for yarn-site.xml parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resourcemanager_fair_scheduler_configuration
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Fair Scheduler XML Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Fair Scheduler XML Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resourcemanager_mapred_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for mapred-site.xml parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_resourcemanager_role_env_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve)
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Environment Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_rm_hosts_allow_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for nodes_allow.txt
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for nodes_allow.txt parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_rm_hosts_exclude_safety_valve
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for nodes_exclude.txt
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ResourceManager Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for nodes_exclude.txt parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_role_triggers
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Role Triggers parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_stacks_collection_directory
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: Stacks Collection Directory
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the Stacks Collection Directory parameter.

items.name: role_config_suppression_yarn_resourcemanager_am_max_retries
items.displayName: Suppress Parameter Validation: ApplicationMaster Maximum Attempts
items.description: Whether to suppress configuration warnings produced by the built-in parameter validation for the ApplicationMaster Maximum Attempts parameter.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_audit_health
items.displayName: Suppress Health Test: Audit Pipeline Test
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Audit Pipeline Test heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_file_descriptor
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the File Descriptors heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_gc_duration
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the GC Duration heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_heap_dump_directory_free_space
items.displayName: Suppress Health Test: Heap Dump Directory Free Space
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Heap Dump Directory Free Space heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_host_health
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Host Health heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_log_directory_free_space
items.displayName: Suppress Health Test: Log Directory Free Space
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Log Directory Free Space heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_scm_health
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Process Status heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_swap_memory_usage
items.displayName: Suppress Health Test: Swap Memory Usage
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Swap Memory Usage heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_unexpected_exits
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Unexpected Exits heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_health_suppression_resource_manager_web_metric_collection
items.displayName: Suppress Health Test: Web Server Status
items.description: Whether to suppress the results of the Web Server Status heath test. The results of suppressed health tests are ignored when computing the overall health of the associated host, role or service, so suppressed health tests will not generate alerts.

items.name: role_triggers
items.description:
The configured triggers for this role. This is a JSON-formatted list of triggers. These triggers are evaluated as part as the health system. Every trigger expression is parsed, and if the trigger condition is met, the list of actions provided in the trigger expression is executed.

Each trigger has the following fields:

  • triggerName (mandatory) - The name of the trigger. This value must be unique for the specific role.
  • triggerExpression (mandatory) - A tsquery expression representing the trigger.
  • streamThreshold (optional) - The maximum number of streams that can satisfy a condition of a trigger before the condition fires. By default set to 0, and any stream returned causes the condition to fire.
  • enabled (optional) - By default set to 'true'. If set to 'false', the trigger is not evaluated.
  • expressionEditorConfig (optional) - Metadata for the trigger editor. If present, the trigger should only be edited from the Edit Trigger page; editing the trigger here can lead to inconsistencies.

For example, the following JSON formatted trigger configured for a DataNode fires if the DataNode has more than 1500 file descriptors opened:

[{"triggerName": "sample-trigger",
  "triggerExpression": "IF (SELECT fd_open WHERE roleName=$ROLENAME and last(fd_open) > 1500) DO health:bad",
  "streamThreshold": 0, "enabled": "true"}]

See the trigger rules documentation for more details on how to write triggers using tsquery.

The JSON format is evolving and may change and, as a result, backward compatibility is not guaranteed between releases.

items.name: stacks_collection_data_retention
items.description: The amount of stacks data that is retained. After the retention limit is reached, the oldest data is deleted.

items.name: stacks_collection_directory
items.description: The directory in which stacks logs are placed. If not set, stacks are logged into a stacks subdirectory of the role's log directory.

items.name: stacks_collection_enabled
items.description: Whether or not periodic stacks collection is enabled.

items.name: stacks_collection_frequency
items.description: The frequency with which stacks are collected.

items.name: stacks_collection_method
items.description: The method used to collect stacks. The jstack option involves periodically running the jstack command against the role's daemon process. The servlet method is available for those roles that have an HTTP server endpoint exposing the current stacks traces of all threads. When the servlet method is selected, that HTTP endpoint is periodically scraped.

items.name: unexpected_exits_thresholds
items.description: The health test thresholds for unexpected exits encountered within a recent period specified by the unexpected_exits_window configuration for the role.

items.name: unexpected_exits_window
items.description: The period to review when computing unexpected exits.

items.name: yarn_am_liveness_monitor_expiry_interval_ms
items.description: The expiry interval to wait until an ApplicationMaster is considered dead.

items.name: yarn_nm_liveness_monitor_expiry_interval_ms
items.description: The expiry interval to wait until a NodeManager is considered dead.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_address
items.description: The address of the applications manager interface in the ResourceManager.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_admin_address
items.description: The address of the admin interface in the ResourceManager.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_admin_client_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads used to handle the ResourceManager admin interface.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_am_max_retries
items.description: The maximum number of application attempts. This is a global setting for all ApplicationMasters. Each ApplicationMaster can specify its individual maximum through the API, but if the individual maximum is more than the global maximum, the ResourceManager overrides it.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_amliveliness_monitor_interval_ms
items.description: The periodic interval that the ResourceManager will check whether ApplicationMasters is still alive.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_client_thread_count
items.description: The number of threads used to handle applications manager requests.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_container_liveness_monitor_interval_ms
items.description: The periodic interval that the ResourceManager will check whether containers are still alive.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_max_completed_applications
items.description: The maximum number of completed applications that the ResourceManager keeps.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_nm_liveness_monitor_interval_ms
items.description: The periodic interval that the ResourceManager will check whether NodeManagers are still alive.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_proxy_user_privileges_enabled
items.description: When enabled, ResourceManager has proxy user privileges.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_recovery_enabled
items.description: When enabled, any applications that were running on the cluster when the ResourceManager died will be recovered when the ResourceManager next starts. Note: If RM-HA is enabled, then this configuration is always enabled.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_resource_tracker_address
items.description: The address of the resource tracker interface in the ResourceManager.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_resource_tracker_client_thread_count
items.description: Number of threads to handle resource tracker calls.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_scheduler_address
items.description: The address of the scheduler interface in the ResourceManager.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_scheduler_class
items.description: The class to use as the resource scheduler.  FairScheduler is only supported in CDH 4.2.1 and later.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_scheduler_client_thread_count
items.description: The number of threads used to handle requests through the scheduler interface.

items.name: yarn_resourcemanager_zk_timeout_ms
items.description: The timeout for the ResourceManager session with ZooKeeper. The session expires if the ZooKeeper ensemble does not hear from the ResourceManager within the specified timeout period (no heartbeat). Session expiration is managed by the ZooKeeper ensemble, not by the ResourceManager.

items.name: yarn_rm_bind_wildcard
items.description: If enabled, the ResourceManager binds to the wildcard address ("0.0.0.0") on all of its ports.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_continuous_scheduling_enabled
items.description: Enable continuous scheduling in the Fair Scheduler. When enabled, scheduling decisions are decoupled from NodeManager heartbeats, leading to faster resource allocations.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_locality_delay_node_ms
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular nodes, the minimum time in milliseconds the Fair Scheduler waits before accepting a placement on another node. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be enabled. If continuous scheduling is disabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality.threshold.node should be used instead.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_locality_delay_rack_ms
items.description: For applications that request containers on particular racks, the minimum time in milliseconds the Fair Scheduler waits before accepting a placement on another rack. Requires Fair Scheduler continuous scheduling to be enabled. If continuous scheduling is disabled, yarn.scheduler.fair.locality.threshold.rack should be used instead.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_fair_preemption_cluster_utilization_threshold
items.description: The utilization threshold after which preemption kicks in. The utilization is computed as the maximum ratio of usage to capacity among all resources.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_increment_allocation_mb
items.description: If using the Fair Scheduler, memory requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 5.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_increment_allocation_vcores
items.description: If using the Fair Scheduler, virtual core requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 5.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_maximum_allocation_mb
items.description: The largest amount of physical memory, in MiB, that can be requested for a container.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_maximum_allocation_vcores
items.description: The largest number of virtual CPU cores that can be requested for a container. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_minimum_allocation_mb
items.description: The smallest amount of physical memory, in MiB, that can be requested for a container. If using the Capacity or FIFO scheduler (or any scheduler, prior to CDH 5), memory requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number.

items.name: yarn_scheduler_minimum_allocation_vcores
items.description: The smallest number of virtual CPU cores that can be requested for a container. If using the Capacity or FIFO scheduler (or any scheduler, prior to CDH 5), virtual core requests will be rounded up to the nearest multiple of this number. This parameter has no effect prior to CDH 4.4.
